briefTitle: A Study to Evaluate the Efficacy, Safety, and Pharmacokinetics of ABT-493 and ABT-530 With and Without Ribavirin in Adults With HCV Who Failed a Prior DAA Containing Therapy
officialTitle: A Randomized, Open-Label, Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Efficacy, Safety, and Pharmacokinetics of Co-Administration of ABT-493 and ABT-530 (or ABT-493/ABT-530) With and Without Ribavirin in Adults With Chronic Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) Infection Who Failed a Prior Direct-Acting Antiviral Agent (DAA)-Containing Therapy

interventions.name: ABT-493, ABT-530
otherNames: ABT-493/ABT-530 (ABT-493 coformulated with ABT-267) also known as MAVYRET

summary: The purpose of this study is to assess the efficacy and safety of ABT-493 and ABT-530 with or without ribavirin (RBV) in participants with chronic hepatitis C virus, (HCV)-infection who previously failed treatment with a direct acting antiviral (DAA)-containing regimen.

primaryOutcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Virologic Response 12 Weeks Post-treatment (SVR12)
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: 12 weeks after the last actual dose of study drug
